channel.title: Woodmont Industrial News Feed
channel.description: Daily industrial and CRE updates across key regions

item.title: Commercial Real Estate in 2026: Key Issues and Outlooks
item.description: Commercial real estate is showing clear signs of strength and resilience as 2026 begins, supported by improving conditions across many markets and asset classes, with some variations, according to an array of NAIOP board members.
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News
item.author: Marie Ruff

item.title: NJBIZ Conversations: Think Simplicit founder Matthew Negron
item.description: The furniture industry veteran discusses his business philosophy, what he looks for in acquisition targets and where he sees the most promising opportunities. The post NJBIZ Conversations: Think Simplicit founder Matthew Negron appeared first on NJBIZ .
item.category: TRANSACTIONS — Notable Sales/Leases (≥100K SF or ≥$25M)
item.author: Jeffrey Kanige

item.title: Revisiting big c-store supply chain moves of 2025
item.description: Love’s and Circle K were among the retailers to sign new or expanded supplier deals, while Kwik Trip and RaceTrac opened distribution centers.

item.author: Jessica Loder

item.title: Saddleback sells new 50,000 sq. ft. industrial building in Hackettstown for $13 million
item.description: Saddleback Real Estate Developers has sold a newly built, 50,000-square-foot industrial building in Hackettstown for $13 million, the Fairfield-based firm announced last week.

item.title: Bayonne waterfront to boast NJ’s largest film studio
item.description: 1888 Studios' recent groundbreaking marked the beginning of a massive production campus with Paramount as anchor tenant. The post Bayonne waterfront to boast NJ’s largest film studio appeared first on NJBIZ .

item.title: Pennsylvania homes get more expensive in November
item.description: Pennsylvania home prices rose 5.2% in November while sales dipped and inventory grew slightly, according to the latest report from the Pennsylvania Association of Realtors.

item.title: SoftBank To Buy Data Center Investor DigitalBridge For $4B
item.description: SoftBank said Monday it has agreed to acquire DigitalBridge in an all-cash transaction valued at about $4B. The acquisition underscores SoftBank’s push into infrastructure that supports artificial intelligence, as investors increasingly back data centers...

item.description: Another shopping mall has sold at a severe discount, adding to the malaise surrounding New England mall properties. Solomon Pond Mall in Marlborough sold for $8.5M to Cleveland-based Industrial Commercial Properties, according to public records. The...

item.title: Academy Sports and Outdoors touts cargo frontloading wins
item.description: Although it was “sweaty knuckles” at first, moving goods ahead of tariff escalations enabled the retailer to sell items at last year’s prices, EVP and CFO Earl Ford said.

item.title: Tariffs, strikes and tragedies: How 2025 transformed supply chains
item.description: Supply chains faced tumult, with changes to U.S. trade policies and labor unrest contributing to a mosaic of uncertainty. Here is a visual look at the busy year.

item.title: Alphabet Reaches Nearly $5B Deal To Buy Data Center Firm Intersect
item.description: Google parent Alphabet reached an agreement to acquire data center and energy infrastructure developer Intersect for $4.75B in cash plus the assumption of debt, the tech giant announced Monday.

item.title: The 9 Largest Eastern Pennsylvania Industrial Groundbreakings Of 2025
item.description: Eastern Pennsylvania has been a poster child for the post-pandemic warehouse construction blitz. That development boom slowed slightly this year, with 32 new projects breaking ground, down from 35 in 2024 and 36 in 2023, according to Lee & Associates....
